intro: Corchorus hirtus var. cuyabensis, commonly known as the Cuyabensis kochia, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, triangular leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or riparian habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
